SEARCH
Package org.boardgames.crossway.model.rules

Class PatternChecker

java.lang.Object
org.boardgames.crossway.model.rules.PatternChecker
public final class PatternChecker extends Object
A utility class for validating game moves against a set of predefined rules.

This class acts as an aggregator for a collection of PatternRule instances. It provides a clean interface for checking a move against all registered rules, returning either the first rule that is violated or a comprehensive list of all violations. This separation of concerns allows for a flexible and extensible rule-checking system, where new rules can be added simply by providing a new implementation of the PatternRule interface.

  • Constructor Details

    • PatternChecker

      public PatternChecker(List<PatternRule> rules)
      Constructs a PatternChecker with a specified list of rules. The list is copied to ensure immutability.
      Parameters:
      rules - The list of PatternRule objects to check against.

  • Method Details

    • firstViolation

      public Optional<PatternViolation> firstViolation(Board board, Move move)
      Checks all registered rules and returns the first violation found for a move.

      This method is efficient for standard game validation, as it stops checking as soon as the first rule is broken. This is useful for quickly determining if a move is invalid without needing to find all reasons.

      Parameters:
      board - The current state of the game board.
      move - The move to validate.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the first PatternViolation found, or an empty Optional if the move is valid against all rules.

    • isAllowed

      public boolean isAllowed(Board board, Move move)
      Determines whether a move is allowed based on all registered pattern rules.

      This is a convenience method that simply checks if firstViolation returns an empty Optional. It's suitable for a simple boolean check of move legality.

      Parameters:
      board - The current state of the game board.
      move - The move to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the move does not violate any rule, false otherwise.

    • allViolations

      public List<PatternViolation> allViolations(Board board, Move move)
      Returns a list of all pattern violations for the given move.

      Unlike firstViolation, this method continues to check all rules and collects every single violation. This can be useful for providing comprehensive feedback to a user about all the reasons a move is invalid.

      Parameters:
      board - The current state of the game board.
      move - The move to validate.
      Returns:
      A List of all PatternViolation objects for the move. The list is empty if no rules are violated.
